modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The focus is entirely on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) which the human subject lacks and God must provide. It is a sermon of 'Incompetence' met by 'Divine Competence'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: De preek beweegt van de valse S1 (Wetticisme) naar de erkenning van S2 (Blindheid), om via het werk van Christus (~S2) uit te komen bij de ware S1 (Genade).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christus ondergaat de S2 (duisternis/oordeel) zodat de hoorder S1 ontvangt.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Zeer hoog; blindheid wordt vergeleken met de dood en totale onmacht.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject and the human as the passive recipient of a gift that cannot be earned or self-generated.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: None found; the preacher explicitly deconstructs 'If I live well, I am saved'.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus was executed so we wouldn’t have to be.
Spiritual sight is not natural for anybody... it has to be a gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Elisha is not used as a moral hero to imitate, but as a type of Christ who mediates grace to enemies.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic regeneration; sight is a work of the Spirit alone.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the OT narrative to the NT fulfillment in Gethsemane is seamless and structurally sound.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus took the punishment so we could get a feast.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a pervasive attitude of the heart that blinds one even to its own existence.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is robustly theocentric. God is the Sender and Subject; Grace is the Object; the Hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to emphasize that 'knowing' (Savoir) is not 'seeing' (Pouvoir).

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent (Blindness/Sin) is already presented as a heavy, cosmic force.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Sight as gift) → Ethics (Feast/Peace with enemies).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented, Christocentric narrative structure that avoids the trap of moralism by making God the Subject of the transformation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'blindness' metaphor, Greimas shows that the 'Subject' of the healing is the crucial theological pivot.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Syrian war; semiotics explains why the 'Subject-switch' from Elisha to Jesus is necessary for the hearer's identity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'bad guys' and 'good guys' in the text share the same actantial role (Blind/Receiver), leveling the moral playing field.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Dothan' connection between Joseph and Elisha to deepen the 'Opponent' actant (suffering as a helper to sight).
